fields.description:
h3. Summary

If you create a transition with a long name and a screen associated with it then the submit button has that text on it and will extend beyond the dialog.
h3. Environment

Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a transition with a long name (around 100 characters)
 # Associate that transition with a screen
 # Perform that transition on an issue and see that the submit button has the transition name on it

h3. Expected Results

The transition name should truncate so that you see the beginning of the word and stay on the dialog

h3. Actual Results

The name does not truncate, it just extends to the left of the dialog so you lose the beginning of the name.

h3. Notes

Short transition name without problem:
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-11 at 10.44.08 AM.png|thumbnail! 

Long transition name with problem:
 !Screen Shot 2016-10-11 at 10.44.20 AM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Use a shorter transition name
fields.summary: Long transition names cause the submit button to extend passed the screen dialog

fields.description:
*To reproduce*
 # In a JIRA cloud instance *without* service desk, create a project ABC
 # Create an issue in ABC
 # Create a user then revoke all their application access.
 # Make a POST request with body: \{{{"body" : "a comment"}}} to  {{/rest/api/2/issue/ABC-1/comment}}

*Expected:*

A 403 response with a JSON error; no comment made

*Actual:*

A 200 response with no body; no comment made
fields.summary: REST requests with basic auth for users without application access return empty 200
Exception when username contains a + character

fields.description:
When you try to change more than 1000 issues, the JIRA system limits it to the first 1000. This is ok, and the number "1000" is reflected in all bulk-change wizard pages, except in the _Bulk Operation_ page, after you confirm.

Steps to repro:
- Use Bulk Change on a query result of > 1000 issues
- Change something (unselect "send mail", it will make this very slow) (I changed Assignee, didn't test with other changes)
- Confirm your change
- You will see something like in the screenshot. My selection was 2300+ issues large, the first time it showed 1028 issues, the second batch showed 1006 issues. I could not verify whether that was the number of issues actually changed, or whether the number was simply wrong.

 !image-2016-06-11-20-04-54-108.png|width=300!
fields.summary: Bulk change shows incorrect number in Bulk Progress page when issues to change is larger than 1000

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When previewing PDFs attached to issues on JIRA Cloud using Internet Explorer 11 or Sfari, most times the file is not previewed as expected.
h3. Environment
 * JIRA Cloud v1000.586.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On Internet Explorer 11 or Safari, open an issue that have a PDF attached;
 # Click on the attached PDF's thumbnail to preview it.

h3. Expected Results

The PDF file is previewed on the screen.
h3. Actual Results

Most times, the preview screen hangs on the loading wheel, or shows the *Ouch! We can't load the PDF** error.
h3. Workaround
 * Download the attached file to the computer to visualize it;
 * Use a different browser (Chrome, Firefox).

h3. UPDATE
I have tested and confirmed that this bug also affects Safari.
fields.summary: PDF preview not working properly on IE11 or Safari

fields.description:
h3. Summary
A dashboard is set to public access but cannot be accessed publicly through a Android mobile Chrome browser. Even thought, the dashboard can be accessed publicly using a computer browser.

Affected version: Last Chrome mobile browser 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Set any dashboard to public access.
# Try to access by using Chrome on a Android cellphone

h3. Expected Results
User can access the dashboard normally.

h3. Actual Results
The Atlassian login screen shows up.

 !Captura de Tela 2017-01-11 às 4.42.40 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround
No workaround at the moment
fields.summary: Dashboard is set to public access but cannot be accessed publicly through a Android mobile Chrome browser

fields.description:
h3. Summary

The problem is similar to [JRA-45776|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-45776] in which the fix has been applied to Due Date but not to Date Picker custom field:
When user edits an issue it's possible to enter an invalid date in a date picker custom field, such as 16/Dec/20016 or 16/Dec/-2016.

h3. Environment

No Look & Feel changes were made, nor were advanced settings for dates configured - everything is left as the default.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a new Date Picker custom field
# Add the newly created custom field to the appropriate screen.
# Edit or create an issue.
# Populate that field with an invalid result, such as 16/Dec/20016.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA returns a validation error as it does for the Due Date field (see screenshot in JIRA 7.1.9 below)
 !2016-08-08_cus-date.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results

The date is persisted in the database and JIRA throws following index warnings:

{noformat}
2016-08-08 10:12:53,406 http-nio-8080-exec-20 WARN admin 612x45x1 1va8kry 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.LocalDateIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'cusdatepicker(customfield_10200) with value: 20016-12-16 00:00:00.0
2016-08-08 10:12:53,477 http-nio-8080-exec-20 WARN admin 612x45x1 1va8kry 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.LocalDateIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'cusdatepicker(customfield_10200) with value: 20016-12-16 00:00:00.0
2016-08-08 10:12:53,615 http-nio-8080-exec-20 WARN admin 612x45x1 1va8kry 0:0:0:0:0:0:0:1 /secure/AjaxIssueAction.jspa [c.a.j.i.i.indexers.impl.LocalDateIndexer] Unable to index custom date field 'cusdatepicker(customfield_10200) with value: 20016-12-16 00:00:00.0
{noformat}
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud does not correctly validate Date input for custom field

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When embedding an image in a JIRA comment that has a JIRA issue ID in the name, JIRA renders the issue ID as a issue link and thus is unable to render the embedded image.

h3. Environment

JIRA v1000.5.1


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an issue
# Attach an image to the issue making sure that the name you give the image has a JIRA issue ID in it
# Attempt to embed the image in a new comment on the ticket


h3. Expected Results

The image should be rendered as normal

h3. Actual Results

JIRA renders the issue ID as a JIRA issue link and displays the error

{{Unable to render embedded object: File not found.}}

!rendererror.png|thumbnail!

 
h3.Workaround

Users will need to rename their images.
fields.summary: Unable to render embedded image with JIRA issue ID in the file name

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a Confluence space is created together with a JIRA project (create linked space to project) and a logo is attached to the space, the attach activity will be shown in the JIRA issues' activity tab for each issue in the project.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create project in JIRA connected to space in Confluence
# Change space logo
# Open a random issue (or create a new one) in the JIRA project 

h3. Expected Results
The Confluence space logo does not appear in the issue history

h3. Actual Results
The linked Confluence space logo appears in the 'Activity' tab for all the issues in the project, also in the newly created ones.


h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud shows the linked Confluence space logo in each issue activity tab

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The "Log Work" functionality is using the JIRA System "Default user time zone" to set the "Date Started".
It should be using the "User Time zone" set in the Profile section

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to an issue, click on "Log Work" and check the Time in "Date Started"
# Change your user timezone by going to your Profile
# Refresh the issue
# Click on "Log Work" and check the "Date Started" field again

h3. Expected Results
The Time defaults to the timezone recently set in the profile

h3. Actual Results
The Time remains the same as before because it still uses the JIRA "Default user time zone"

h3. Notes
Changing the JIRA "Default user time zone" under "General Configuration" will change the time shown by default by the "Log Work", confirming the link between them.
All other dates in the issues, such as Created, Updated, Comment times, change accordingly to the user timezone.
fields.summary: JIRA Cloud - Log Work uses Default user timezone instead of User's timezone

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When an anonymous user views the system dashboard the top menu is not displayed if you have an application navigator link restricted to a group.

h3. Environment
* JIRA v1000.110.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Select Cog Icon > Applications.
# Select Application Navigator.
# Add a new link and restrict this link to jira-users.
# Log off the instance and access the System Dashboard.
#* https://yourdomain.atlassian.net/secure/Dashboard.jspa.

h3. Expected Results
The System Dashboard should display the top men when browsing as anonymous user.

h3. Actual Results
The System Dashboard do not display the top menu if you have an application navigator link set for a restricted group.

h3.Workaround
Remove the group restriction from any link in Application Navigator.
fields.summary: System dashboard is not displaying the top menu for anonymous users.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When a parent issue is cloned along with it's sub-tasks, the content of the custom fields of the source sub-tasks are not populated in the resulting cloned sub-tasks.

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud (7.2.0-OD-03-010)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field and associate it with the sub-task issue type.
# Create a parent issue and several sub-tasks
# Edit the sub-tasks and populate the custom field
# Clone the parent issue and ensure the "Clone sub-tasks" option is selected.

h3. Expected Results
Sub-tasks associated with the cloned parent issue retain the values present in the custom fields of the sub-tasks they were cloned from.

h3. Actual Results
Custom fields are blank for the cloned sub-tasks.

h3.Workaround
No known workaround at this time.
fields.summary: Cloned Sub-Tasks Do Not Retain Custom Field Values

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The EPIC STATUS which is a locked field and thus users are not able to edit it. No longer have the options. After testing into older jira-dev instance and newer prod instances this is easily noticeable. This is also breaking the 'Mark as done' button while in the Epics Backlog.

* Older version with EPIC Status working (tested with JIRA  v1000.477.0)
 !olderversions.png|thumbnail! 

* Newer version with EPIC Status only settable to 'none''
  !Screen Shot 2017-01-11 at 6.30.26 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Environment

* Tested with JIRA Cloud Prod Instances and test ones 


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add the Epic Status field to the view issue screen
# Create an Epic
# Try to change the status, it will be only able to set to none.

h3. Expected Results

Be able to normally edit the epic status, and be able to use the "Mark as done" button from the backlog

h3. Actual Results
The only available status for Epic Status is "None"
 
h3. Notes
(Optional - If Necessary)

h3.Workaround
None at the moment
fields.summary: Epic Status field options are missing

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Transition cannot be done due to a condition that is always returning false, even though it was supposed to return true. The condition is the following:
{quote}The field Security Level will have to be equal to value 'SomeString'. Compared as String.{quote}

It works if the same condition is used but comparing the Option ID instead of String.

h3. Environment

Cloud JIRA v1000.110.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add this condition to a workflow transitions: {quote}The field Security Level will have to be equal to value 'ABC'. Compared as String.{quote}
# Change the Issue Security and make the issue be in the 'Security Level' 'ABC' (so the condition should be true)
# You won't see the transition even though you should be able to
# Remove the condition and you see the transition

*So the Value Field condition is not working when comparing 'Security Levels'*

h3. Expected Results

To be able to transition the issue since the condition is supposed to return true

h3. Actual Results

Not able to see the transition
 
h3.Workaround

# Compare using 'Option ID' instead of string
# Use Security Level ID instead of name (I tested and it worked)
fields.summary: Transition cannot be done due to a Value Field condition

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce: 
1. Add Time Since Gadget to dashboard
2. Enter a filter which doesn't exist
3. Save

Expected:
An error message in the appropriate language

Actual:
The i18n key for the error message
fields.summary: Time Since Gadget errors display as i18n keys instead of actual text

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce:*
1. Associate a non-software workflow to a project. (A workflow where every status is not a global status)
2. Create an issue.
3. Search the issues in that project.
4. Open the issue search detail view.
5. Perform a transition.

*Expected result:*
After the transition is done, the transition button disappears.

*Actual Result:*
The transition button is still present and does not go away until the page is refreshed.

*Workaround:*
Refresh the page.
fields.summary: On issue search detail view and SD queues, the transitions buttons are not going away after transitioning

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking issues bar on Projects gadget redirects to Issue Navigator with empty JQL, It contains the following URL, it then shows empty JQL and returns result:
- !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail!

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Add _Projects gadget_ on a dashboard
# Click _Opened Issues bar_
# It redirects to {{https://<instance URL>/issues/?/issues/?jql=project+%3D+<project key>+AND+resolution+is+EMPTY+AND+priority+%3D+%223%22}}

h3. Actual Result

Issue navigator shows empty JQL and result

h3. Expected Result

Issue navigator shows the correct JQL and returns the results

h3. Workaround

Manually go to _Issue Navigator_ and key in the JQL.
fields.summary: Clicking issues bar on Projects gadget redirects to Issue Navigator with empty JQL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Color pallet is dislocated on the screen.

h3. Environment
* Chrome
* Firefox
* Safari

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any ticket on JIRA
# Click on description or comment
# Select some text
# Click on change font color arrow down

h3. Expected Results
The pallet of color should show up next to the text color button. E.g.:
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-03 at 4.14.37 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
The pallet color is showing up in the end of the page. E.g.:
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-03 at 4.11.22 PM (2).png|thumbnail! 

On the developer panel:
{code}Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'nodeType' of null{code}

h3. Notes:
(!) There are cases where the pallet won't show up at any position on the screen. E.g.: on the create issue pop-up

h3.Workaround
You can still select the desired color from the pallet that it will change your text.
OR
You can add the color tags: {noformat}{color:#14892c}colored text{color}{noformat}
fields.summary: Color pallet does not show-up in the correct position on screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Cloud Customers are unable to view or edit Versions in their project though they appear in the Summary Page
h3. Environment
 * 1000.73.0

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Unable to reproduce as new Versions created are show in the "Releases" view

In the Customer's Environment:
 # Click on Releases in the sidebar and no Versions are shown
 # Go into the Project's settings, Versions are shown in the Project Summary
 # Click on Versions in the Project Settings sidebar, no Versions are shown; this appears to the same "Releases" page
h3. Expected Results

All Versions show
h3. Actual Results

Looking at the Project Summary, we see multiple versions listed, however if we click the Versions link in the sidebar, no versions are shown. Noticed that the URL for this Version "Releases" Page is {{[https://URL/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/administer-versions|https://url/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/administer-versions]}}

Using a different URL {{[https://URL/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/versions|https://url/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/versions]}}, we can see the Components that were created
h3. Notes

This behaviour may happen when using an Ad Blocker using EasyPrivacy ( [https://easylist.github.io/] ) setting. Make sure this is not enabled in the browser.

Attempted to create versions in the 'versions' URL and they show in 'administer-versions'
h3. Workaround

Navigate to the Versions page using below url:
 {{[https://URL/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/versions|https://url/plugins/servlet/project-config/PROJECTKEY/versions]}}
fields.summary: Unable to View or Edit Versions in a Project

fields.description:
h3. Summary

POP mail servers that are set up in JIRA may experience duplicate issue creation as a result of the JIRA 7.1.0-OD-01 release on November 23rd.

h3. Environment
* JIRA 7.1.0-OD-01
* POP mail servers

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have emails in your POP mail server

h3. Expected Results
1 issue is created or one comment is created per email.

h3. Actual Results
Two issues are created, and the following may appear in the logs
{noformat}
javax.mail.MessagingException: A14 BAD Command Argument Error. 11;
  nested exception is:
	com.sun.mail.iap.BadCommandException: A14 BAD Command Argument Error. 11
	at com.sun.mail.imap.IMAPMessage.setFlags(IMAPMessage.java:905)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.internal.DefaultMailLoopDetectionService.isPotentialMessageLoop(DefaultMailLoopDetectionService.java:57)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractMessageHandler.canHandleMessage(AbstractMessageHandler.java:437)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.AbstractCommentHandler.handleMessage(AbstractCommentHandler.java:108)
	at com.atlassian.jira.plugins.mail.handlers.CreateOrCommentHandler.handleMessage(CreateOrCommentHandler.java:98)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$1.process(MailFetcherService.java:435)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService$MessageProviderImpl.getAndProcessMail(MailFetcherService.java:301)
	at com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailFetcherService.runImpl(MailFetcherService.java:423)
{noformat}
 

h3.Workaround
Use IMAP for your mail server, this will prevent issue duplication. Follow [Configuring JIRA to Receive Email from a POP or IMAP Mail Server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracloud/configuring-jira-to-receive-email-from-a-pop-or-imap-mail-server-735941059.html] for instructions.
fields.summary: JIRA creating duplicate issues from email via POP

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Destination step doesn't reflect actual statuses names on edit transition screen

See video: [^statusname.mp4]

h3. Steps to Reproduce 
# Update the name of an status
# Open an workflow (edit mode) that's using that status
# Click on a transition that's has the edited status as destination
# Click on 'Edit'
# There you'll see that 'Destination Step' doesn't show the new name of the status

h3. Expected Results
'Destination Step' should show the new name of the status

h3. Actual Results
'Destination Step' doesn't show the correct information

h3. Workarounds
-
fields.summary: Destination step doesn't reflect actual statuses names on edit transition screen

fields.description:
h3. Summary
JIRA takes a few minutes to clone an issue.
It seems clone actions are now executed via the scheduler, which can get held up waiting for other operations to complete (sending mails, etc).

h3. Environment
JIRA Cloud (JIRA v1000.526.2)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open any issue
# Click on  {{...}} > {{Clone}} > {{Create}}

h3. Expected Results
The operation should take a few seconds.

h3. Actual Results
It takes several minutes to have the clone created. No error on logs/UI

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: JIRA takes a few minutes to clone an issue

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Clicking on components doesn't open the issue navigator view.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a project component
# Go to the component pages
# Click on the component.

h3. Expected Results

You are redirected to the issue navigator, where all issues assigned to the component are filtered.

h3. Actual Results

Nothing happens.

h3. Notes

Tested on MacOS on both Firefox and Google Chrome.

h3.Workaround

Right click on the link and open on a new tab.
fields.summary: Unable to click on Component links.

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In Cloud, when installing ZenDesk and uninstalling it (maybe other plugins may be affected), if we remove the user ‘addon_zendesk_for_jira’, if this user is associated with other contents in JIRA.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

#* The ‘addon_zendesk_for_jira’ will be created for it

h3. Notes
We could see that:
# The user was no longer present in User Management and its database ‘cwd_user’ table
# The user is still present in JIRA’s ‘cwd_user’, as it has association to existing content
# Re-creating the user manually doesn’t help, as it creates a different error


h3.Partial Workaround
*The following workaround may not work in some situations, for example, were the user is author of comments or history entries. Since this requires changes in issues, if possible, test it first:*
# Find all links to this user (issues assigned, issues it’s a reporter of, etc.)
# Change it to a different user (assign/change reporter to different users)
# Create a user with the username ‘addon_zendesk_for_jira’
# Delete it
#* This user should be deleted from the database in JIRA
# Install the add-on
fields.summary: Uninstalling Zendesk and removing its user may prevent future installations

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If the _average_ time to first response for a given project or filter is less than an hour, the "Time to First Response" gadget won't display any data.

h3. Steps to reproduce
# Create two users and a new project in JIRA.
# Add the Time to First Response gadget to a dashboard with the new project selected in the "Projects or Saved Filter" field.
# As User 1, create an issue in that project.
# Wait for half an hour, then add a comment on that ticket as User 2.
# Refresh the Time to First Response gadget.

h3. Expected results
The graph in the gadget displays half an hour as the time to first response.

h3. Actual results
The gadget displays no data.

h3. Notes
If another issue is added and commented on, there will be no data displayed _until_ the average time of the first response between the two issues is greater than one hour.
fields.summary: Time to First Response gadget won't display if average time is less than an hour

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When using a group comment visibility on worklogs the restriction is not applied in the Activity Stream.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Set up a test user (JIRA Users).
# Enable comment visibility to support groups as per [Configuring JIRA Options|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+JIRA+Options].
# With an admin user, log work on an issue and set the visibility to a group.
# Access an activity stream with the test user (JIRA Users).

h3. Expected Results

The Activity Stream does not expose information about the log work event to the user.

h3. Actual Results

The Activity Streams leaks the worklog comment, despite being marked as restricted to a specific group.

h3. Workaround

Disable group comment visibility, or ensure users only restrict worklogs to project roles.
fields.summary: Restricted Work Log entries show in the Activity Stream for JIRA Cloud

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Some databases contain some 'invalid' characters that are exported via Backup Manager. These files could be imported before with JIRA importer, but cannot anymore.

Some characters that are preventing the import are: {{^L}} (Form Feed, 0x0C) and {{^H}} (Backspace, 0x08) (check [this|http://donsnotes.com/tech/charsets/ascii.html]).

h3. Environment
* With tests, we could see that this import worked in {{7.0.0-OD-08-005}}, but fails in {{1000.184.1}}.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a JIRA with some of the invalid characters in the database
# Export it
# Try to reimport it

h3. Expected Results
Either:
# Backup Manager filters out these characters on exporting
# Import removes them or imports with them.

h3. Actual Results
This error is shown on import (the import is not started):
{noformat}
An invalid XML character (Unicode: 0x8)
{noformat}
 
h3.Workaround
Use [XML Cleaner|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jira/removing-invalid-characters-from-xml-backups-12079.html] on {{entities.xml}}.
fields.summary: JIRA import is no longer accepting files with characters like ^L and ^M

fields.description:
h3. Summary
In the [JIRA Workflows|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jiracorecloud/workflows-765593798.html] documentation, the link in the paragraph to *Project Types* leads to a forbidden page for customers, and a blank page for Atlassian staff.

h3. Notes
Is it possible that we want it to point to this location? 
[JIRA applications and project types overview|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiracloud/jira-applications-and-project-types-overview-776636162.html]
fields.summary: Link on Cloud Workflows documentation broken

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When editing the global time tracking, it sticks. However when clicking on "Edit Global settings" it shows something else than the current setting.

h3. Environment
* Cloud - JIRA v1000.610.2

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Click on the cog icon at the top right > select issues.
# On the left menu, click on *Time Tracking*
# In the option "Default unit for time tracking" it will be showing "day" for example, click *edit global settings*

h3. Expected Results
In default unit it should show Day.
h3. Actual Results
The default unit is showing Minute.

h3. Notes
"No workaround"
fields.summary: Time tracking not updating

fields.description:
h3. Workflow condition prevents issue from auto transitioning

If the {{hide transition}} condition is included on a transition, the transition itself will be prevented from working.


h3. Environment

* JIRA Misc Workflows Extensions and JIRA Suite Utilities plug-ins might be required.


h3. Steps to Reproduce


Sub-task configuration: 

# Have a project with sub-task issue type context
# On the sub-task workflow, go to Open ---> In progress transition.
# Click on "post functions" and add: {{Transition In Progress will be triggered on the issue's parent issue.}}
# Save and publish the draft

Parent workflow configuration

# Go to Open --> In Progress transition and click on "Conditions".
# Add the condition: {{hide transition}}
# Save and publish the draft


h3. Expected Results

Transitioning the sub-task should automatically transition the parent issue

h3. Actual Results

Parent is not transitioned
 
h3. Notes

Here I used a sub-task / parent relationship as example, but please note that the bug affects any kind of automatic transitions.

h3.Workaround

Remove the "hide transition" condition
fields.summary: Hide transition condition prevents issue from auto transitioning

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Activity Stream Macro for JIRA displays "No Activity was found" when user modifies the Max results (over 100+) in the the RSS URL feed and accesses the URL. 

h3. Environment

* Cloud: 7.1.0-OD-03-049
* Chrome: 47.0.2526.106 (64-bit)
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Log into Cloud instance
# Create new Dashboard
# Add the *Activity Stream* Gadget
# Gadget by default should work as intended
# Grab the RSS feed: https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/activity?maxResults=10&os_authType=basic&title=undefined
# Modify the maxResults=100000
# Insert URL into an RSS reader: https://EXAMPLE.atlassian.net/activity?maxResults=100000&os_authType=basic&title=undefined
# JIRA Activity Stream Macro will no display results as well as no show available Activity Streams.


h3. Expected Results

# For Activity Stream to display results when using the UI. 

h3. Actual Results

# Every time the RSS reader attempts to access the URL the Activity Stream timeout and displays no results
!results.png|thumbnail!
# This also causes the Activity Streams of all apps to go missing.
 
h3.Workaround

Remove edits made to the RSS URL and use system default when access the RSS feed for JIRA Cloud Activity Stream Macro. Currently max system default is 100. https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/activity-stream-gadget-218275789.html
fields.summary: Activity Stream Macro for JIRA displays "No Activity was found" when user modifies the Max results (over 100+) in the the RSS URL and accesses the URL

fields.description:
h3. Summary
The option to export to Excel in a CSV format is missing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Perform a JIRA Issue Search
# Configure custom Columns and Column Order
# Export Issues to CSV using Export > Excel (CSV, Current Fields) or Excel (CSV, All Fields) 

h3. Expected Results
The option should be available.
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-07 at 12.42.52 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
There are no options.
 !Screen Shot 2016-06-07 at 12.42.34 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes
- Appears that the Excel (CSV) Export options were added in April 19th but listed as a Service Desk Feature: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/Cloud/What's+New#What'sNew-servicedesk

- It worked on verison 1000.25.1 Cloud.

h3.Workaround
Use the Excel (HTML, Current Fields) or Excel (HTML, All Fields) export instead.

Be aware of the following:
- Fields that only export to Excel HTML has: 
{{Affects Version/s, Components, images, labels, progress, and sub-tasks}}

- Fields that only export to Excel CSV has: 
{{comment, issue id, parent id, project description, project key, project lead, project type}}
fields.summary: Missing Export Excel CSV option

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Using date picker custom field with the format "d/MMM/yy", and setting a date after 2030, automatically change the year to 19XX.
h3. Affected Version

JIRA v1000.844.1
 JIRA v1000.711.0
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a date picker custom field
 # Associate the custom field with the project
 # Create a new issue
 # Set any date > 01/Jan/2030

Note that the date was changed to 01/Jan/30 (01/01/1930)
h3. Expected Results

Keep the correct date which was set.
h3. Actual Results

It automatically set the wrong year. All the issues with the wrong year are resulting in JQL queries with "date picker custom field" <(now)
h3. Workarounds
 * Set a year < 2030. (ie. 31/Dec/29)
 * Use a date format for the year of "yyyy"
fields.summary: Date picker custom field with the format "d/MMM/yy", and setting a date after 2030, automatically change the year to 19XX.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When adding the 'Assign to Default Role Member' post-function to the 'Create' transition of a workflow, the issue fails to auto-assign.

h3. Environment
(Optional - If Applicable)
* JIRA v1000.253.3
* JMWE v4.0.3-Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new project
# Edit the Create issue transition by adding a post-function to it
# Select the Assign to Default Role Member post-function
# Pick any project Role
# Make sure the post-function appears in the list after the issue create action
# Go into System > Project Roles
# Add a user to the group as a default member
# Make sure the user has Assignable User permissions in the project
# Make sure the user is part of the specific role within the project
# Create a new ticket

h3. Expected Results
The ticket should automatically assign to the default member of the project role you specified in the post-function

h3. Actual Results
The ticket is created but the assignee is left as unassigned
 
h3. Notes
It should be noticed that the JMWE add-on will be removed in September. More information can be found here:

*JIRA Miscellaneous Workflow Extensions (JMWE) removal from JIRA Cloud*
- https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/jira-miscellaneous-workflow-extensions-jmwe-removal-from-jira-cloud-815262011.html?utm_campaign=jira_jmwe-unbundling&utm_medium=email&utm_source=alert-email

- A ticket has been opened with Innovalog as well for this issue

h3.Workaround
Currently using a post-function that automatically assigns to a specific user can be UserData i.e., Update issue field
fields.summary: Assign to Default Role Member post-function in JMWE addon does not work when added to create transition

fields.description:
h3. Summary

In one of the latest JIRA updates, there was an unexpected change in how Version Picker (multiple version) custom fields display.

Instead of showing a simple button to click and display the version (filtering as characters are entered), a list of versions is shown in Edit Screen for issues (regardless of whether the users started editing this field).

The Affects Version/s, Fix Version/s are still as they used to be.

It used to look like the 'Fix Version/s' still looks like (this field also allows multiple version, but it's a system field):
!fix_version.png|thumbnail!

However, the custom field looks like this now (it was not selected or focused):
!cf_version_picker.png|thumbnail!

This is not happening in the Create Screen in most cases, but we can see it when editing the issue.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a Version Picker (multiple versions) custom field
# Add it to a project’s Edit and View Screens
# Create an issue using these screens
# Edit it


h3. Expected Results
The versions are only listed when the field is selected, just like Fix and Affects Version/s fields.

h3. Actual Results
A permanent list of versions is displayed, taking up space.
 
h3. Notes
There was a change just like that to version 7.1.0-OD-02 described [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/cloud/29-november-2015-to-5-december-2015-790960148.html]:
{quote}
We've made selecting the quick filters on the Release (JIRA Software) or Versions (JIRA Core) page more intuitive by removing the drop-down and adding persistent 'sticky' labels. This allows you to quickly filter your versions by Released or Unreleased, and we've even made the search bar a little slicker too. Try it to see what we mean!
{quote}

However, this change was to the Release and Version pages, not to the fields in the issues. This planned change in the Release/Version page may have inadvertently changed the custom fields in JIRA as well, for example, in case this field's render uses the same methods as the Release/Version pages.

h3.Workaround
None so far.
fields.summary: Unexpected change in Version Picker (multiple version) custom field

Manually link the cloned issue to the respective Epic

h3. Summary

Database queries generated by issue picker functionality are impacting performance and causing outages in JIRA Cloud instances.
h3. Environment

JIRA Cloud
h3. Update (11-11-16)

A fix for this issue has been deployed to all production Cloud instances. 
h3. Workaround

There is an automatic script fixing sites showing this behaviour but feel free to get in contact with Cloud Support at support.atlassian.com for a manual workaround if your site is unavailable.
fields.summary: Issue Picker Queries Causing Isolated Outages in JIRA Cloud

h3. Summary
Opening an attachment in a new tab/window starts the file download

h3. Environment
JIRA v1000.670.2 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Open an issue
# Add an attachment
#* Some attachments cannot be previwed so you can test a {{.jpg}} file
# Click on the attachment
#* It can be viewed without download 
# Right-click on the attachment and open it in a new tab
#* The file won't be shown and its download will start

h3. Expected Results
The file is shown in a new tab

h3. Actual Results
The download of the file starts
 
h3. Notes

This is occurring for multiple file types -- jpg, png, mov, mp4, and probably more.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Opening an attachment in a new tab starts the file download

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-65008].
  {panel}

Kyle has requested that I submit the following changes.

 

On the below URL, there are a few typos

[https://www.virtuox.net/Services/VirtuSOMInsomniaTesting]

 

*we want to delete the following:*

*Are There Other Consequences?*

The most immediate effect of sleep apnea is the daytime fatigue and risk of falling asleep at work or while driving. Other potential effects of sleep apnea include serious health problems such as high blood pressure, heart problems, diabetes and stroke. It can also lead to depression, irritability, sexual dysfunction, learning and memory difficulties. Studies show that up to 50 percent of sleep apnea sufferers have high blood pressure. Studies show that up to 70% of sleep apnea sufferers have diabetes

 

*We want to replace with:*
h2. *Are There Other Consequences?*

The most immediate effect of sleep apnea is the daytime fatigue and risk of falling asleep at work or while driving. Other potential effects of sleep apnea include serious health problems such as high blood pressure, heart problems, diabetes and stroke. It can also lead to depression, irritability, sexual dysfunction, learning and memory difficulties. Studies show that up to 50 percent of sleep apnea sufferers have high blood pressure. Studies show that up to 70% of sleep apnea sufferers have diabetes.
fields.summary: Change to Virtusom page

Unfortunately, the Version column wraps text if the description is long.  It would be nice if either the columns were adjustable in size or if the version column did not wrap a word.

As an issue creator, I want to avoid unnecessary keyboard and mouse operations when entering issues.  

JIRA 7.2.4, Chrome 56.0.2924.87
h3. Current behavior
 * Enter some text
 * Select some or all of it with mouse or keyboard
 * Press Ctrl-K to create an external link
 * {color:#ff0000}Select dummy URL with mouse or keyboard{color}
 * Type or paste-in correct URL
 * Resume editing rest of sentence

h3. Desired Behavior
 * Enter some text
 * Select some or all of it with mouse or keyboard
 * Press Ctrl-K to create an external link
 * {color:#14892c}Dummy URL is automatically selected by editor{color}
 * Type or paste-in correct URL
 * Resume editing rest of sentence

*Summary*

As peer [this documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/advanced-searching-fields-reference-764478339.html#Advancedsearching-fieldsreference-FixVersionfixVersionFixversion], *NOT IN* and *IN* should work for:

* releasedVersions()
* latestReleasedVersion()
* unreleasedVersions()
* earliestUnreleasedVersion()

However, *NOT IN* and *IN* operators not working for latestReleasedVersion() and earliestUnreleasedVersion().

*Steps to Reproduce*

Try to perform a JQL search calling latestReleasedVersion() and earliestUnreleasedVersion() using NOT IN and IN operators.

*Expected Results*

Find the issues that matches the filter.

*Actual Results*

Get message like this:

\{code}Operator 'in' does not support the non-list value 'earliestUnreleasedVersion()' for field 'fixVersion'.\{code}

*Workaround*

Use operators *=* and *!=* instead of *NOT IN* and *IN*.
fields.summary: NOT IN and IN operators not working for latestReleasedVersion() and earliestUnreleasedVersion()

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64976].
  {panel}

Please improve [Installing+JIRA+Data+Center|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/AdminJIRAServer073/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center] documentation page.
Suggested changes: 
* Include section about ports used by JIRA DC, see as a example: https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/42692523/what-is-the-random-port-opened-by-jira-datacenter-used-for-and-what-is-the-range-of-choices
** Main idea: JDC in addition to usual ports used by JIRA used 2 more ports for Ehcache: _40001_ and _40011_ (_TCP ephemeral port_) 
* Include firewall recommendation, partially done in _Security_ section 
** Until feature request JRA-64974 is implemented, large range of ports needs to be open (depends on OS, see [TCP ephemeral port|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port]). 
** In JIRA 7.3 specific ports can be used
fields.summary: Include firewall configuration into JIRA DC docs

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64974].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
JIRA Datacenter (JDC) uses Ehcache as caching technology, cache server which exposes available cache operations remotely through RMI. Ehcache requires two port for it's network operations, _RMICacheManagerPeerListener_ paramets
* hostName - may be null, in which case the hostName will be looked up.
* port - a port in the range 1025 - 65536
* remoteObjectPort - the port number on which the remote objects bound in the registry receive calls. This defaults to a free port if not specified.
* cacheManager - the CacheManager this listener belongs to
* socketTimeoutMillis - TCP/IP Socket timeout when waiting on response

see: http://www.ehcache.org/apidocs/2.6.9/net/sf/ehcache/distribution/RMICacheManagerPeerListener.html

Currently in JDC you can specify only *port* (default = 40001, setting: ehcache.listener.port), see [Cluster.properties file parameters|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+Data+Center#InstallingJIRADataCenter-Security]
Another *remoteObjectPort* is dynamically allocated and [TCP ephemeral port|https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port] is selected. So you need to open wide range of port at firewall. 

Without opening the port, the following error is displayed as other nodes start up :
{code}2017-03-22 11:53:38,023 ehcache-replicator-0 WARN      [c.a.j.cluster.distribution.JiraCacheManagerPeerProvider] Looking up rmiUrl //ip-x-x-x-x:40001/com.atlassian.jira.project.util.CachingProjectKeyStore.cache threw a connection exception. This could mean that a node has gone offline  or it may indicate network connectivity difficulties. Details: Connection refused to host: ip-x-x-x-x; nested exception is:
        java.net.ConnectException: Connection timed out
{code}

h3. Suggested Solution
Add option to specify *remoteObjectPort* (RMI port)

h3. See related links:
* https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/42692523/what-is-the-random-port-opened-by-jira-datacenter-used-for-and-what-is-the-range-of-choices
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Java_remote_method_invocation
* https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ephemeral_port

h3. Workaround 
Open all *Ephemeral_port* range in firewall and allow connection from all JDC nodes. 

h3. Feature introduced in JIRA 7.3
New variable: *ehcache.object.port*
Default port: *40011*

Ticket to update docs: JRA-64976
fields.summary: As an JIRA Datacenter Administrator I want specify ehcache RMI port
Improve JIRA Datacenter node replication documentation

Does such a function already exist? Lemme know ;) Do not hesitate to ask us any further questions.

Best wishes

Christopher from EPOS CAT GmbH

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64954].

Our team manages deployments for all our cloud customers. As such, I'm marking this request for improved platform support as invalid.

We have a related Jira Server ticket for this issue, see linked issues and watch that for updates on our [Jira Server and Data Center products here.|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64954]

Thanks!

Steve King
Product Manager
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, Atlassian applications are using a variety of recommended database collations when using MSSQL Server ([JRA-62362|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-62362]). For example, JIRA requires case-insensitive, accent-insensitive collation while Confluence requires case-sensitive, accent-sensitive collation. 

These disparities and the resulting differences in documentation among applications can create confusion when setting up a database on Windows Server.

h3. Suggested Solution
The setup wizard should create a database with a name specified by the JIRA administrator and a default collation type (SQL_Latin1_General_CP437_CI_AI).

h3. Why this is important
Ensuring a smooth setup reduces administrator burden and reduces opportunities for later difficulty.
fields.summary: Setup wizard should create/set up database when using MS SQL

If user macros are defined in a velocity template, they can potentially be included without rendering due to a Velocity bug https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY-776

Ideally JIRA will update its internal version of Velocity1.7/VelocityTools>= 2.0 which contains  the fix, released 17 JUL 2016.  Currently JIRA 7.3 is shipping with V1.6.4

The workaround is put UserMacro definitions inside ./atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/classes/templates/email/macros.vm so they are defined statically.

Standard atlassian email notifications won't be affected by this as its templates are loaded statically

Update: [Velocity 2.0.x is not yet released|http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/velocity-dev/201701.mbox/ajax/%3Ce7a74998-fac9-ef2b-ceca-df3a4e9623fc%40renegat.net%3E]  despite [release date being set|https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/VELOCITY/?selectedTab=com.atlassian.jira.jira-projects-plugin:versions-panel] - the 2.0. release is actually available, so must be transitioning/being announced : https://dist.apache.org/repos/dist/dev/velocity/velocity-engine/2.0/release-notes.html

*Used Case*
1. Customer reports a ticket (Service Desk)

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Cloud*. Using *JIRA Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-64931].
  {panel}

The [Skipping major versions when upgrading JIRA applications|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver071/skipping-major-versions-when-upgrading-jira-applications-802592265.html] documentation is currently outdated and does not mention crucial upgrade notes to take note of.

For example, when upgrading to JIRA Software 7.0, the [Upgrade notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-7-0-x-upgrade-notes-824352098.html] mentioned that the upgrade path is *JIRA 5.1 or earlier* -> *JIRA 5.2 or later* > *JIRA Software 7.0*. Failing to comply with this will not allow the user to upgrade:
 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

Another point to take note of is that if the customer is using JIRA Agile versions that are older than 6.4.0, they are unable to upgrade directly to JIRA 7.1.0 as mentioned in [This version of JIRA Agile requires a minimum build number of #45 in order to proceed|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/this-version-of-jira-agile-requires-a-minimum-build-number-of-45-in-order-to-proceed-812222943.html].

On the ServiceDesk side, the minimum version to upgrade to 3.2.0 is JIRA 7.0 and/or JIRA Service Desk 3.0 at least. This is mentioned in the [JIRA Service Desk 3.2.x release notes|https://confluence.atlassian.com/servicedesk/jira-service-desk-3-2-x-release-notes-830281732.html].
fields.summary: Update documentation in regards to Skipping major versions when upgrading JIRA applications
